intro: Mascagnia ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous mascagnia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive corolla. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a waxy texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
